item.title: Cartier discloses data breach amid fashion brand cyberattacks
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Luxury fashion brand Cartier is warning customers it suffered a data breach that exposed customers' personal information after its systems were compromised. [...]

item.title: The North Face warns customers of April credential stuffing attack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Outdoor apparel retailer The North Face is warning customers that their personal information was stolen in credential stuffing attacks targeting the company's website in April. [...]

item.title: SentinelOne: Last week’s 7-hour outage caused by software flaw
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: American cybersecurity company SentinelOne revealed over the weekend that a software flaw triggered a seven-hour-long outage on Thursday. [...]

item.title: Google Chrome to distrust Chunghwa Telecom, Netlock certificates in August
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Google says it will no longer trust root CA certificates signed by Chunghwa Telecom and Netlock in the Chrome Root Store due to a pattern of compliance failures and failure to make improvements. [...]

item.title: Microsoft and CrowdStrike partner to link hacking group names
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft and CrowdStrike announced today that they've partnered to connect the aliases used for specific threat groups without actually using a single naming standard. [...]

item.title: ‘Russian Market’ emerges as a go-to shop for stolen credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The "Russian Market" cybercrime marketplace has emerged as one of the most popular platforms for buying and selling credentials stolen by information stealer malware. [...]

item.title: Microsoft ships emergency patch to fix Windows 11 startup failures
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released an out-of-band update to address a known issue causing some Windows 11 systems to enter recovery and fail to start after installing the KB5058405 May 2025 security update. [...]

item.title: Qualcomm fixes three Adreno GPU zero-days exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Qualcomm has released security patches for three zero-day vulnerabilities in the Adreno Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) driver that impact dozens of chipsets and are actively exploited in targeted attacks. [...]

item.title: Exploit details for max severity Cisco IOS XE flaw now public
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Technical details about a maximum-severity Cisco IOS XE WLC arbitrary file upload flaw tracked as CVE-2025-20188 have been made publicly available, bringing us closer to a working exploit. [...]

item.title: Hackers are exploiting critical flaw in vBulletin forum software
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Two critical vulnerabilities affecting the open-source forum software vBulletin have been discovered, with one confirmed to be actively exploited in the wild. [...]

item.title: Microsoft now testing Notepad text formatting in Windows 11
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced today that the Windows 11 Notepad application is getting a text formatting feature supporting Markdown-style input. [...]

item.title: Police takes down AVCheck site used by cybercriminals to scan malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An international law enforcement operation has taken down AVCheck, a service used by cybercriminals to test whether their malware is detected by commercial antivirus software before deploying it in the wild. [...]
